abstract: Twitter serves many purposes - meme manufacturing, revolution aggregation, troll facilitation - but it also functions as a real-time discussion board for the things we see on television.
snippet: Twitter serves many purposes - meme manufacturing, revolution aggregation, troll facilitation - but it also functions as a real-time discussion board for the things we see on television.
lead_paragraph: Editor's Note: In the new issue of the magazine, Dan Kois - cultural critic and noted spoilerologist - wrote a Bonus Feature on "The New Rules for TV Spoilers," in part inspired by the furor on Twitter over spoilers for the recent season finale for "Breaking Bad." This is a special extended version of that piece, for The 6th Floor:

headline.main: The New Rules for TV Spoilers
